channel.title: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, and Xubuntu in one CD?
channel.description:
Do you think the people that make *Ubuntu should put all three on one DVD/CD somehow?
I like KDE on fast computers because of it's nice interface, and I have a Kubuntu CD. I like GNOME on my computer, because I like how it is, and I have a Ubuntu CD. I like Xfce on slow computers because it looks good and runs really fast and uses little RAM, and I have a Xubuntu CD.
Now, I hate having to carry 3 CD's with me all the time so the person that wants Linux can choose between these three desktop environments. Is there already something like this, or should we make a suggestion to the *Ubuntu developers?

item.title: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, and Xubuntu in one CD?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

It isn’t hard to have three WMs on one disk, you know.

Read full topic
item.source: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, and Xubuntu in one CD?

item.title: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, and Xubuntu in one CD?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

From any install you can:

apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
apt-get install kubuntu-desktop
apt-get install xubuntu-desktop

After it is installed, but if you are just carrying it around to use on computers why not pick one and stick with it? (also you can build your own livecd (or DVD in this case I’m sure) if you want all window managers, but there doesn’t seem to be a need.

Read full topic
item.source: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, and Xubuntu in one CD?

item.title: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, and Xubuntu in one CD?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

ThugLife:

You carry Linux cd’s around with you, all the time?

i do that, if some windows user wants to protect his files by imposing one of those silly password protected accounts, just boot to ubuntu live CD and see the files from there.

ok im lying, thats the idealistic reason,

the real reason is that sometimes at school i like to boot to ubuntu and go on firefox and/or pidgin without the incredibly annoying feature blocking
anyway, its better then letting it sit around on my shelf

Read full topic
item.source: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, and Xubuntu in one CD?

item.title: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, and Xubuntu in one CD?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

If you start with Ubunutu there is some simple commands you can run to DL and install the other Desktop Environments. Can’t remember off the top of my head, but if you wanted you could have XFCE, KDE and Gnome all one single install.

Read full topic

@Rajae wrote:

Do you think the people that make *Ubuntu should put all three on one DVD/CD somehow?

I like KDE on fast computers because of it’s nice interface, and I have a Kubuntu CD.
I like GNOME on my computer, because I like how it is, and I have a Ubuntu CD.
I like Xfce on slow computers because it looks good and runs really fast and uses little RAM, and I have a Xubuntu CD.

Now, I hate having to carry 3 CD’s with me all the time so the person that wants Linux can choose between these three desktop environments. Is there already something like this, or should we make a suggestion to the *Ubuntu developers?
